Class Interval

  • java.lang.Object
    • Interval
  • public class Interval
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a closed real-valued interval
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Quastor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double DEFAULT
      Value to create the default interval [-DEFAULT, DEFAULT]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Interval()
      Constructs the default interval [-DEFAULT, DEFAULT]
      Interval​(double a, double b)
      Constructs an interval from given a, b endpoints
      Interval​(Interval other)
      Copy constructor, constructs an interval from another one

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean containsInnerPoint​(double x)
      Takes a point x and checks if x is an inner point of the interval
      boolean containsThePoint​(double x)
      Takes a point x and checks if the interval contains the point x
      Interval[] divide​(double x)
      Takes a valid interval and an inner point x from the interval, and divides it into 2 intervals [a,x] and [x,b]
      Interval[] divideDeviation​(double x, double deviation)
      Takes a valid interval and an inner point x from the interval, and divides it into 2 intervals [a,x - d] and [x + d,b] with deviation d from the point
      double getA()
      Returns the a endpoint
      double getB()
      Returns the b endpoint
      boolean isValid()
      Checks if the interval is valid
      double midPoint()
      Returns the middle point

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the interval is valid
        Returns:
        true if the interval is valid (a < b)

      • containsThePoint

        public boolean containsThePoint​(double x)
        Takes a point x and checks if the interval contains the point x
        Parameters:
        x - The point to check
        Returns:
        true if the interval contains the point x

      • containsInnerPoint

        public boolean containsInnerPoint​(double x)
        Takes a point x and checks if x is an inner point of the interval
        Parameters:
        x - The point to check
        Returns:
        true if x is an inner point of the interval

      • divide

        public Interval[] divide​(double x)
        Takes a valid interval and an inner point x from the interval, and divides it into 2 intervals [a,x] and [x,b]
        Parameters:
        x - A point that divides the interval
        Returns:
        An array with two intervals after the division. If the interval is invalid, point is not inner or the point doesn't belong to the interval, the output might contain invalid intervals

      • divideDeviation

        public Interval[] divideDeviation​(double x,
                                  double deviation)
        Takes a valid interval and an inner point x from the interval, and divides it into 2 intervals [a,x - d] and [x + d,b] with deviation d from the point
        Parameters:
        x - A point that divides the interval
        deviation - deviation from the point
        Returns:
        An array with two intervals after the division. If the interval is invalid, the point is not inner, the point doesn't belong to the interval or the deviation is excessive, the output might contain invalid intervals
